meanings.definition: A band or strip that crosses another band or strip.
meanings.sent1: The red crossband stood out against the white background.
meanings.sent2: She tied a crossband around the gift box to make it look festive.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the crossband as a tightrope to reach the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: The crossband of stars in the night sky seemed to connect the earth to the heavens.
meanings.sent5: The crossband of colors in the rainbow was a beautiful sight after the rain.

meanings.definition: To place a band or strip across another band or strip.
meanings.sent1: He carefully crossband the tape over the torn paper to hold it together.
meanings.sent2: The workers will crossband the wooden planks to create a sturdy bridge.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to crossband the bacon strips on top of the burger for a unique presentation.
meanings.sent4: She wanted to crossband the ribbons on the gift box in a crisscross pattern.
meanings.sent5: The artist planned to crossband the different fabrics to make a patchwork quilt.
